GEHYR ÐU MIN BEARN geboda ðines lareowes and anhyld þinre heortan eare, and myngunge þines arfæstan fæder lustlice underfoh and caflice gefyl, þæt ðu mid þinre hyrsumnesse geswince to Gode gecyrre, þe þu ær fram buge mid asolcennysse ðinre unhyrsumnesse.

Eornestlice min spr<../images/etail.gif>c and lar is to æghwylcum þara asend, þe his agenum lustum wiðsæcð and mid þam strencstum and þam beorhtestum hyrsumnesse wæpnum drihtnum Criste soðum cyninge hyrsumian wile, ærest þinga swa hwylc god swa þu beginst, þæt hit ðurh drihten to fulfremedum ende cuman mote, mid singalum gebede geornfullice gewilna.

Þæt ure heofenlica fæder, þe us him to bearnum teleð, næfre ðurh ure yfelan dæda ne geunrotsige and on us his graman sette, him is on elcne timan to hyrsumienne mid þam godum, þe he us geunnen hæfð, þilæs þe he us beyrfewerdige, ðæt is, fram his eadignesse ascyrie, swa swa fæder deþ his bearn, þonne he him for his gyltum gram bið and his æhta him ne an, na þæt an, þæt he us æhta bedæle, ac þæt he us, þe him to wuldre fylian nellaþ, swa swa egeful hlaford, mid urum yfelum dædum gegremed, to ecum wite ne sylle.
Utan eornestlice on sumne timan astandan ðurh haliges gewrites myngunge, þe þus cwyð: Nu is tima, þæt we of slepe arisen, þæt is, þæt we synna geswicen and on godum weorcum wacule syn.

Mid openre gymenne godcundes andgytes we eac gehyren, hwæt dæghwamlice sio godcunde stefn myngað and clypað ðus cweþende: Gyf ge todæg Godes stefne gehyren, nellen ge elciende eowere heortan ahyrdan; and eft þus cweþ: Se þe hlystes earan hebbe, gehyre hwæt þæt haliggast to eallum þam, ðe to Gode gelaðede syn, cwiþ: Cume ge mine bearn, gehyrað me; Godes ege ic eow tæce; yrnað and onettað, þa hwile ðe ge lifes leoht habban, þylæs ðe deaðes þystra eow gelæccen.
And drihten on micelre folces menige smeað and scrutnoð, hwæt ða feawa syndan, þe his willan wyrcen willen, and ðus acsiende cwyþ: Hwa is manna, þæt lifes wilnige and gode dagas geseon wille?

Gif þu þis gehyrende andswarast: ic eom se þe ðæs wilnað, God ælmihtig ðus to þe cwyþ: Gif ðu habban wille soð lif and ece, forhafa þine tungan fram yfelre spræce and ðine welras nan ðing facenlices ne sprecen; buh fram yfele and wyrc god; sec sibbe and hyre gefolga.
Ðenne ge þus doð, min ansyn bið ofer eow and min hlyst æt eowrum benum, and ær ge me to clypian, ic cweþe: Efene nu ic eom geara to eowere neode.
Hwæt is lustlicre to gehyrenne þenne þeos laþiende Godes stefn?
Efene nu drihten ðurh his mildheortnesse us lifes wegas anywyþ.

We eornestlice mid clænnesse modes and lichoman and mid geleafan and godra weorca biggenge and mid haligra mægena hæfene his wegas geornlice faren and geearnian, þæt we hine, þe us to ðam wege gelaþode, on his rice geseon moten.
Natoþæshwon his rices eardung bið gefaren buton mid gymene and gehealdsumnesse godra dæda; ofst and hradung godra weorca is to þæm rice weges færeld.
Ac uten ahsien urne drihten þurh þæs witegan myndgunge þus cweþende: Drihten, hwa mot wunigean on þinre eardungstowe and hwam is rest geunnen on þinre halgan dune?

We gehyraþ æfter ðisse æscan drihten andswariendne and þone weg his eardunge þus tæcendne: Se on rihtne weg færð to minum rice, þe butan leahtra besmitenesse wunað and rihtwise weorc begæþ, and se þe soð on his heortan beðencð and facenlices nan ðing mid his muþe ne clypað, and se þe his neahstan yfeles nan ðing ne dyde, and se þe hosp and edwit on his neahstan ne sette, and se þe þone awirigedan deofol, ælces yfeles lareow fram his heortan awyrpð mid ealre his lare and hine for naht teleð, and ealle his geþohtas and hopan on God beset, and þa þe God ondr<../images/etail.gif>daþ and hy þurh heora godan dæda ne anhebbaþ, ac drihten, þe þa god on hi worhte, weorðiaþ and mærsiað, þus mid þæm witegan clipiende: Na us, drihten, na us, ac þinum naman sele þu wulder.

Swa eac Paulus þurh his mæran bodunge him sylfan nanes lofes ne tilade, ac eal þæt lof Gode betæhte, þe him snytera and wisdom sealde, ðus cweþende: þurh Godes gife ic eom þæt þæt ic eom; eft se sylfa Paulus cwiþ: Se þe wuldrige, wuldrige on God ælmihtigne and no on hine sylfne.

Be þæm ilican andgyte se hælend cwiþ on þæm halgan godspelle þus clypiende: Se þe gehyrþ þas mine word and hi mid weorcum gefylð, ic hine gelicne læte wisum were, ðe ofer fæstum stane bytlode; flodas coman, windas bleowan and þæt hus swiðlice gespurnun, and hit no feol, forðy þe hit gestaþolod wæs ofer fæstum stane.
Ealle god wyrcende and on his halgan gefyllende and tremegende drihten geanbidaþ, hwæþer we mid weorcum his lare gefyllan willen.
For bote urra synna þises lifes dagas us to fyrste forlætene synt, swa cwyþ se apostol: Wast þu ðe nast, þæt Godes geþyld þe to dædbote gelaþaþ?
Soðlice mildheort drihten þus cwyþ: Ne wilnege ic ðæs synfullan deaðes, ac þæt he gecyrre and lif age.

Þa we eornostlice urne drihten ahsedon be þæm bugendum his eardungstowe, we gehyrdan hwæt þa gebodu synd, þe we þa eardunge mid geearnian sceolon; mid gefyllednesse goddere þenunge we weorðaþ heofena rices yrfeweardes.
We forþy heortan and ealne lichoman to gecampe gegearwian and to hyrsumnesse halgra gebeda.
Þæt we þurh tyddyrnesse mennisces gecyndes þurhteon ne magon, we urne drihten geornlice biddæn, þæt he us þurh his gife gefultumige to gelaste laste his geboda.

And gif we hellewites susla forbugan willað and to ecum life cuman, þa hwile þe we moten and on þisum lichoman wuniað and ealle þas forsprecenan þing ðurh lifes lyhtinge gefyllen magon, is to hradienne and to efstenne þæt us on ecnesse to life gefyrðrige.
Toþi þenne ic eornestlice settan wille bysega and bigengas þysses drihtenlican þeowdomes.

Þeah hwet teartlices hwæthwara stiðlice on þisum regule, þe ures færyldes latteow to Criste is, geset and getæht sy, for gesceades rihtinge and for synna bote and soðere sibbe gehealdsumnesse, ne beo þu þurh þi forht and afæred, ne þurh yrhþe ðinre hæle weg ne forlæt.

Þæs weges ongin, þe to Criste læt, ne meg beon begunnen on fruman butan sumre ancsumnysse, ac þa geþingþa halegera mægena and se gewuna þisse halgan drohtnunge, þe gedeþ leafleoht and eaþe, þæt ðe ær earfoðe and ancsumlic þuhte.
Se weg is rum and forðheald, þe to deaðe and to hellewite læt; se is neara and sticol, þe to life and to heofona rice læt.

He is us þeah to gefarenne mid rumheortum mode and mid godum and glædum geþance and mid gefyllednesse Godes geboda, swa þæt we on mynstre þurhwunigen on Cristes lare and tæcinge, þæt we hine geefenlæcende mid geþylde earfeþa and eahtnesse þolien, þæt we his rices gemænnesse and gefean mid him agan moten.

Her geendiaþ þa capitulas.
BE MUNUCA CYNNE.
Feower synt muneca cyn.
Ðæt forme is mynstermonna, þæt is þara þe under regule and abbodes tæcincge on gecampe wuniað.

Oþer cyn is ancrena, þæt is westensetlena, þe no on niwan wylme, ac on lancsumere mynsteres drohtnunge geleorniað, þæt hie anstandonde mid Godes fultume þurh broðra getrymnesse ongean deofol and his flæsces and geþohta leahtras winnan magan.

Þridde cyn is muneca ealra atelucost, sylfdemena, þe no on regules and lareowa tæcinge ne beoð afandode swa swa gold on heorðe, ac æfter leades gecynde on costnunge gemyltað and awacigað and on woruldþingum ealne heora hiht besettað, and swylce hie mid sceare and munuces hiwe God ælmihtigne pæcen.

Ða wuniað twam and þrim ætgædere and hwilon ænlipige, no on Godes eowode belocene, ac on agenum lustum beswicene; him is for æ heora idelra gewilnunge lust; swa hwylc idel swa him to geþance yrnð and him gecoren bið, þæt hie taliað halig, and swa hwæt swa him oflicað, þeah hit halig sy, hie hit lætað unalyfed.

Þæt feorðe muneca cyn is, þe is widscriþul genæmned, þa ealle heora liflade geond missenlice þeoda farað and twam and þrim dagum geond missenlicra monna husum wuniað, æfre unstaþolfæste and woriende, agenum lustum and heora gitsunge unalyfedlice fyliað and hyrsumiað.
On eallum þingum hie synt wyrsan þænne þa sylfedeman, þe on anre wununge stilnesse healdað; be heora ealra earman drohtunge sel is to swigienne, þonne embe to sprecenne.
We þas forði forlæten and to þæm <stræcstum> mynstermonna cynne gecyrren and Gode fultumigendum heora drohtnunge geendebyrden.
HWYLC SE <ABBOD> BEON SCYLE.
<Abbod>, ðe ðæs wyrðe sy, þæt he mynsteres wealde, he sceal a gemunan, hwæt he gecweden is, and þæs ealdorscipes noman mid dædum gefyllan.

Cristes gespelia he is and his note and spelinge on mynstre healt; he forþi his agenum naman geciged is, geseðendum apostole and þus cweðendum: Ge onfengon bearna gewiscinge gast, on þæm we clypiað abba, þæt is fæder.

And hit forði næfre ne geweorþe, þæt abbod ænig þing lære oþþe gesette oðþe hate, butan Godes bebode; ac his hæs and lar, þæsma godcundre rihtwisnesse, on his underþeoddera modum sy symble geondstregd; sy he a gemyndig, þæt mycel smeauncg bið on þæm egefullum Godes dome, ægðer ge ymbe his lare, ge ymbe his underþeoddra hyrsumnesse.
Wite he eac, þæt he bið gewitnod swa swa gymeleas hyrde, gif se hyredes ealdor, þæt is drihten, to lytele note and nytwyrðnesse on his heorde angyt.

And he eft æt þam dome freo and carleas bið, gif he mid ealre gymene þa ungehyrsuman heorde gehylt and his seocum, þæt is synfullum dædum ealle lacnunge gegearewade, þus mid þæm witegan cweþende: þine rihtwisnesse, drihten, ic on minre heortan ne bediglode, soðfæstnesse þine and halwendnesse ic gesæde, hy þeah forhogiende me forsawon, ðurh þy þonne wite and deað ricsað on þa ungehyrsuman heorde his gymene.

Eornostlice, se þe þone mæran noman abbodes underfehð, he sceal mid twyfealdre lare þa wyldan and tyn, þe him underþeodde synt, þæt is þæt he ælc god and halignesse mid godum dædum swiðor tæce, þonne mid worda lare, þæt þa andgytfullan mid worda lare to Godes willan gemyngode syn and þa unandgytfullan mid godum dædum getrymede and anbryrde hine geefenlæcen.

Eal þæt he forbeode and his gingrum læþe, he þæt no mid weorce ne gefremme; gif he þonne wel lærð and yfele mid weorce bysenað, he bið forþearlice aworpen, and drihten þurh his witigan to him synfullum þus clypað: Hwy cwyst þu mine rihtwisnesse and hwy nimest þu mine beboda on þinne muð?
Þu soðlice hatodest rihte lare and awurpe mine word wiðæftan þe.
Þu gesawe gehwæde mot on þines broðor eage and ne gesawe þone mæstam cyp on þinum agenum eagan.
Þæt is on andgite: þu asceonudest þa læstan gyltas on þine gingran and þa mæstan noldest on þe sylfne.

Ne sie fram abbode hada toscead on mynstre gehealden, þæt is ne sy nan fram him geweorðad for gebyrdum oðþe for ylde oþþe for ænigum oþrum þingum, butan for Godes ege anum and for soþes wisdomes gesceade.

Ne sceal he nænne swiðor lufian þonne oþerne, butan he hwylcne on godum dædum and on hyrsumnesse beteran ongyte; ne sceal he þone æþelborenan settan beforan þane þeowborenan, gif se þeowborena ær on þæm mynstre wæs, butan he for hwylcum gesceade hit do, þæt is, gif se æþelborena mid godcundum cræfte þone unæþelborenan oferþyhð, sy he gemedemad furður be his geearnungum þonne se unæþelborena.
Na be gebyrdum anum þis is to healdenne, ac be ealles mynstres endebyrdnesse, þæt se sy furþor forlæten on stealle and on setle, se þe furðor on geearnunge for Gode sy.

Sy swylcera gebyrda oþþe gecyrrednesse swylce he sy, butan hwylc þonne oþerne mid geearnunge oferþeo, sy he gemedemad on stede and on setle, swa swa his gecerrednes sy, for þon ge þeow ge freoh, ealle we synd an Criste an.
And under anum Gode gelicne þeowdom we underfengon, forðan þe mid Gode nis anfangennes nanra hada, þæt is nanes riceteres, ne ylde, butan geearnunge anre.
Ealle he sceal gelice lufian his underþeoddan, and eallum him sceal beon an steor and an lar, æfter heora geearnunga anddyfene.
Abbud sceal symle on his lare healdan þone apostolican cwide, on ðam he cwæþ: þrea and witna and halsa and cid; he sceal mencgan þa reðnesse wið þa liðnesse.

He sceal gedon, þæt his reðnes ateowe fæderlice and arfæste lufe, þæt is, þa unstillan and þa heardheortan he sceal þreagean, and þa gehyrsuman and þa mildan and þa geþyldigan he sceal witnian and halsian, þæt hy bet and bet don, and þa gymeleasan and þa oferhogiendan he sceal ægðer ge mid wordum, ge mid dædum þreagan.
Ne sceal he hit no yldan and hiwian, swilce hit him uncuð sy, ac sona swa he hwæt unrihtes ongyte, he hit sceal sona mid ealle him fram adon; he sceal geþencean þæs sacerdes frecednesse Eli of Silo.

Þam godum, gif hy hwæt misdoð, he sceal mid wordum styran, and þæm þweortymum mid swingellum and mid licumlicre clænsunge; he sceal geþencean þæt hit is awriten: ðam dysegan ne mæg mon na mid wordum gestyran, and eft on oþre stowe: Sleah þine sunu mid gyrde, þonne alyst þu his saule from deaðe.
Se abbod sceal simle gemunan, þæt hit awriten is, þæm þe bið mare befæst, from þæm eac mare bið abeden.

He sceal geþencan, þæt he swiðe uneþelice wisan underfehð, þæt is, þæt he sceal rædan and racian oþra manna saulum, sumum mid olæcungum, sumum mid þreaungum, sumum mid lare, no þæt an, þæt he sceole symle gyrnan, þæt he him þæs befæsten eowdes nanne æfwirdlan næbbe, ac eac þæt he mage gefeon be þæm wæstme heora godra weorca.
Ne sceal him na lytel þincean, se underfeng saula reccendomes, þara he sceal ealra riht agyldan on domesdæge.

Ne sceal he syfian ne mænan ymb woruldspeda, forþæm hit is awriten: Secað ærest Godes rice and his rihtwisnesse, he eow gifeþ eal, þæt ge beþurfan; and eft hit is awriten: Ne bið nan wana, þam þe God on riht ondrædað.
Wite eac se abbod, þæt se þe onfehð saula to ræccænne, he gearwað hine selfne to dome on þæm dome on domesdæge, and þær he sceal riht agyldan for ealle þa þe he onfeng, and eac for his agene saule.
BE ÐY ÐE MON EAL GEFERE ON HEALECUM GEÐEAHTE GELAÐIGE.
Swa oft swa ænig ðing healices on mynstre to donne sy, gelaðige se abbod eal þæt gefere and secge eallum, embe hwæt neoda to smeagenne sy.
And heora ealra geþeaht gehyrende smeage on his agenum geþance and þæt do, þæt him selost þince.
Forþi þonne we eal gefere to geþeahte gelaðian heton, forði þe oft God þan ginstum anwryhð, hwæt selost sy to healdenne.

Þeahtigen þænne þa broþru and swa ræd syllen mid ealre eadmodnesse and underþeodnesse, þæt nan ne gedyrstlæce mid anwilnesse his agenne ræd to bewerigenne, ac stande eal seo geþeahtung on þæs abbodes dome, and do þæt him selost and halwendost þince, and hie ealle gemænelice him to þæm hyren geornlice.
Ac ealswa hit geriseð, þæt þa geongran þam yldrum hyren, swa eac geriseþ, þæt se ealdor, þæt is se abbud, swiðe rihtlice and foreþanclice eal gestyhtige and gesette, þæt him gemæne bið.
On ælcum þingum hie sceolon habban þone regol to lareowe, and no of þæm abugan þurh ænige gedyrstignesse; ne sceal nan mon on mynstre girnan, þæt he his agenum willan folgie.
Ne eac sceal nan mon geþristlæcan, þæt he aht stiþlices spræce ongean his abbod, nauþer ne binnan mynstre ne butan; gif hit hwa deþ, þonne sceal he underhnigan þære steore regollicre lare.
Wite se abbod þeah, eal þæt he do, þæt he hit do mid Godes ege and gehealdsumnesse þæs regoles, forðæm þe butan tweon he sceal ealra his doma riht agyldan beforan þæm rihtwisan deman on domesdæge.
Gif þonne hwylc læsse þing sie to smeagenne, þonne hæbbe he þara yldestra manna geþeaht, forðæm hit is awriten: Eall þæt þu do, do hit mid geþeahte, þonne ne gehreoweð hit þe na.
BE GODDRA WEORCA TOLUM.
Ærest mon sceal God lufian of ealre heortan and of eallum mode and of eallum mægene, and æfter þon his nyhstan, swa swa hine sylfne.

Ne sceal mon manslean, ne on unriht hæman, ne stelan, ne unalyfedlice gelustfullian, ne leasunga secgan, ac ælcne man mon sceal arweorðian, and ne sceal nan mon don oþrum, þæt he nelle, þæt him mon do.

Mon sceal his agnum lustum wiðsacan and folgian Cristes lare; his lichoman gehwa sceal clænsian, þæt is mid forhæfdnesse wyldan; estmettas no to grædiglice mon ne sceal lufian, ac fæsten mon sceal lufian.
Earme mon sceal hyrtan and nacode scrydan; untrume neosian and deade bebyrgean; geswenctum helpan and sariendne frefrian.
And fram weoruldwilnungum hine sceal gehwa fremdian and nan þing beforan Cristes lufe settan.
Yrre ne sceal mon fulfremman; yrsunge tidelice sceal mon gehealdan; facn ne sceal mon on heortan gehabban; lease sibbe ne sceal mon syllan; soþe lufe ne sceal mon forlætan.
Swerian ne sceal mon, þylæs mon forswerige; soðfæstnesse of heortan and of muðe mon sceal simle forðbringan.

Ne sceal mon yfel mid yfele gyldan, ne nanum men nænne teonan ne don, ac þonne him mon yfel do, he sceal geþyldelice aræfnian; his fynd mon sceal lufian for Godes lufan; þa wergendan ne sceal mon na ongean werian, ac ma bletsian; ehtnesse for rihte mon sceal eaðmodlice geþolian.
Ne sceal mon beon ofermod, ne druncengeorn, ne oferæte, ne toslapol, ne slaw, ne gnorniende, ne tælende.
Ac ealne his tohopan he sceal habban on God; ðonne he hwæt godes deþ, þonne sceal he þæt eal tellan to Gode, and þonne he hwæt yfeles deþ, he sceal witan, þæt þæt cymð of him sylfum.
Domesdæg he sceal simle geþæncean, and hellewitu he him sceal a ondrædan, and þæs ecean lifes he sceal mid ealre geornfulnesse girnan, and ælce dæge he him sceal deaðes wenan.

His weorca he sceal giman on ælce tide, þæt þa gode sien, and he sceal geþencan, þæt he nahwer Gode dygle ne bið, ac he hine æghwær gesihþ; þa yflan geþohtas, þe him on mod becumað, he sceal sona on Criste toslean and his gastlican lareowe andedtan.
Ðonne he hie toslyhð on Criste, þonne he geðenceð Cristes þrowunge and his wundra and mid þæm geþohtum aflymeð þa yfelam geþohtas.
His muð he sceal from ælcum þweoran and yflum wordum gehealdan; ne sceal he fela sprecan, ne idele word ne leahtorbere; ne hleahter ne sceal he lufian.
Halige rædan he sceal lustlice gehyran and gelome on gebedum beon; his forðgewitenan yfelu he sceal dæghwamlice mid tearum Gode andettan and hie georne betan.

Ne sceal he his lichoman luste folgian; his agenne willan he sceal onscunian, and his abbodes bebodum on eallum þingum he sceal hyran, þeah hit sy, swa swa hit ne gedafenað, þæt he wyrs do, þonne he lære.
Hie sceolan gemunan þone drihtenlican cwide, on ðæm he cwæþ: þæt þæt hie eow secgan, do ge þæt, and þæt þæt hie don, ne don ge þæt.

Ne sy nan lofgeorn, ne wilnigende, þæt his dæda halige gesæde sien, ær hie halige weorðan, ac hicge, þæt hit mid soðe gesæd beon mæge; he sceal Godes bebodu dæghwamlice mid godum dædum gefyllan and his clænnesse lufian; ne sceal he nænne mon hatigan; ne sceal he andan and æfest healdan, ne geflit lufian.

He sceal upahefednesse forfleon and his ealderas weorðian and his geongran lufian; for Godes lufan for heora fynd hie sceolan gebiddan; ær sunnan setlgange hie sceolan to sibbe fon wiþ þa ungeþwæran; and he næfre ne geortreowe be Godes mildse.

Efne nu þis synd gastlices cræftes tol and gebytla; ðænne hie from us dæges and nihtes unablinnendlice beoþ gefyllede and on domesdæge eft betæhte, seo med us bið from drihtne agolden, þe he sylfa behet, þæt is: þæt mænnisc eage for hire mærðe micelnesse geseon ne mihte, ne mannes eare gehyran, ne on mannes heortan ne astah, ðe God ælmihtig gegearwað eallum þam, þe hine lufiað.
On mynstres claustre geferrædene staþolfæstnes ealle þas þenunge began sceal and geornfullice wyrcean.
BE HYRSUMNESSE.
Ðære forman eaðmodnesse stepe is hyrsumnes butan elcunge.
Seo gedafenað þæm þe nan þing him leofre ne lætað, þonne Crist ælmihtigne.
Þa hie begað for heora halgan þeowdomes behate, oþþe for hellewites ogan, oððe for ðæs ecan lifes wuldre.
Sona swa heom ænig þing fram heora ealdre geboden bið, hi þæt butan elcunge mid weorce gefremmað, swylce hit fram Gode sylfum geboden sy.
Be swilcum drihten þus cwyð: Of eares hlyste he hyrsumode me.
Eft he to lareowum þus cwið: Se þe eow gehyrð, he gehyrð me, and se þe eow mishyrð, he mishyrð me.

Eornostlice, þa þe þyllice synt, sona swa him hwæt beboden bið, heora agenne willan aweorpað and swa hwilce bysiga, swa hy on handa hæfdan, unfulworhte lætað and mid hwatum hyrsumnesse fet þæs beodendan stefne mid weorce gefolgiað, and swilce on are berhthwile seo foresæde þæs lareowes hæs and þa fulfremedan þæs lærincmannes weorc mid Godes eges cafscipe gemænelice butu þa þing beoð gefyllede.

On swylcum wunað seo lufu þæs færeldes to ecum life, forði þonne hi þæne ancsuman weg geceosað, be þæm se hælend cwyð: Ancsum and neara is se weg, þe to life læt, þæt is, þæt he be his agenum dome ne libbe, ne he agenum lustum ne hyrsumige, ac be fremedum dome and hæse donde sy, on mynstre wunigende, þæt abbod his wealde and tæce, a gewilnige.
Buton tweon, þa þe þilice beoð, hi geefenlæcað þone cwide, þe drihten be him sylfum þus cwæþ: Ne com ic toþi, þæt ic minne agenne willan worhte, ac þæs, þe me hider sænde.

Ðeos sylfe hyrsumnes bið Gode antfenge and mannum lufteme, gif þæt gebodene bið gefremed unforhtlice and unsleaclice and unasolcenlice and butan ceorunge and butan nellendes andsware; seo hyrsumnes to soðe, þe bið þæm ealdrum gegearwod, heo bið Gode gedon; he soðlice sylf þus cwæþ: Se þe eow gehyrð, he gehyrð me.
And mid godum mode and glædum geþance þa underþeoddan leorneras heora ealdrum hyran sceolan, forði butan tweon þæne glædan hyran God lufað and þone unrotan hataþ.

Witodlice, þeah hwylc leorninccniht his ealdres gebodu mid weorce gefremme, gif he hit mid muðe beceorað oþþe mid mode besargað, ne bið hit þeah Gode andfenge, þe ælces mannes heortan þurhsyhð, ac for swylcere dæde he nane mede æt Gode ne onfehð, ac gyt ma on ecum wite mid þam murcnerum, þe Gode mishyrdon, bið geset, butan he mid fulre dædbote his ungeþanc gebete.
BE SWIGAN.
Utan don swa swa se witega myngað, þus cweðende: Ic cwæþ, þæt ic beheolde mine wegas, þæt ic ne gylte þurh mine tungan; ic gesette minum muþe heordnesse; ic adumbade and an godum clypungum gestilde.

Mid þissum wordum se halga witega gesweotulað, þæt we sceolan idelra worda for synna wite geswigian: þonne he for swigan mægene foroft godra clypunge geswac, eornostlice mon sceal idelra worda geswican.

Þeah fulfremedum leornerum for swigean hefignesse seldhwænne leaf geseald sie to sprecenne ymbe halige spræca and ymbe þære saule getimbrunge, forði hit þus awriten is on halgum bocum: On mænigfealdre spræce ne bið syn forbogen; and eft is awriten: Deað and lif on þære tungan handa.
Soþlice þæm lareowe gedafenað, þæt he sprece and tæce, þam leornere gerist, þæt he swigie and gehyre.
Forþi þonne gif hwæt to ahsienne sy fram þam ealdre, þæt sy geahsod mid ealre eaðmodnesse and underþeodnesse willa and micelre arweorðnesse.

Ne he on ðam furþor ne sprece, þonne hit framige; gegafspræce and idele word and þa word, þe leahter astyrien, ecum loce on eallum stowum we geneoþeriað and forbeodaþ, and to swylcere spræce nan leornere his muð næfre mid minre leafe ne ontyne.
BE EAÐMODNESSE.
Godcund gewrit us to eaðmodnesse myngað þus clypiende: ælc þe hine anhefð, he bið geneoþerad, and ælc þe hine mid eaðmodnesse geneoþerað, he bið mid weorðmynte onhafen.

Þurh þas clypunge is gesweotolad, þæt ælc upahafednes asprincð of modignesse cynrene; wið þone unþeaw hine bewarode se witega, þus cweþende: Drihten, nis min heorte onhafen, ne mine eagan up abrodene, ne ic ne ferde on mærðum, ne wundorlice mid getote ne bode.
Ac hwæt þonne, gif ic eaðmodlice me sylfne ne understode, ac min mod on modignesse anhofe?
Agyld þu me, drihten, mid biternesse lean, swa swa modor deþ hyre bearne, þonne hio hit fram hire breosta gesoce weneþ.

Forði þonne gif we þone hrof þære healican eaðmodnesse getillan willað and to ðære heofonlican anhefednesse, þe mid þises andweardes lifes eaðmodnesse bið gestigen, caflice cuman þencað, seo hlædder is urum dædum to arærenne, þe Jacobe on swefne wearð anywed, þurh ða him wæron gesweotolade ægðer ge upstigende englas ge niþerstigende.
Nis butan tweon to understandenne se upstige and se niþerstige on nane oþere wisan, butan þæt heofona rices upstige mid eadmodnesse geearnod bið and mid ofermettum forwyrht.

Seo arærede hlædder tacnað ure lif on ðisse weorulde, ðæt bið mid eaðmodre heortan þurh drihten aræred to heofonum; þære hlædre sidan tacniað lichoman and saule; on ðæm twam sidum, þæt is on saule and on lichoman, missenlice stæpas eaðmodnesse and þeawfæstnesse sio godcunde gelaðung to ðæm upstige gefæstnode.
BE ÐAM TWELF STÆPUM EALRE EAÐMODNESSE.
Ðære forman eaðmodnysse stæpe is, þæt gehwa Godes ege hæbbe and ætforan his eagena gesyhðe singallice sette and ne sy ofergyttol, ac a gemyndig ealra þara þinga, þe ure drihten bebead.
Sy he eac gemyndig, hu ða for hiora synnum on helle behreosað, þe his beboda forseoð, eac swylce wealce a on his mode embe þæt ece lif, þe God gegearwod hæfð eallum þæm, þe hine andrædað.

And þus smeagende gehealde he on ælcne timan fram his synnum and leahtrum, ægþer ge geþohta, ge spræce, ge gesyhþe, and fram eallum yfelum dædum mid ofste his agene lustas and his flæsces gewilnunga gewanige; wite manna gehwylc, þæt he bið a gesewen fram drihtne of heofonum on godcundre gesyhþe and on ælcne timan.

On ælcere stowe his dæda beoð gesewene fram godcundre gesyhþe and on ælcne timan fram englum gebodode; þæt God on urum geþohtum andwearde is, se witega gesweotelað þus cweþende: God asmeað ægðer ge manna heortan ge æddran; eft he cweð: God cann manna geþohtas; eft he cwyð: Drihten, þu angete mine geþohtas feorrene, and: Mannes geþanc ge geandet.
Toþi þæt he carful sy ymbe his þweoran geþohtas, simle se nytwyrða broðor þus mid his heortan clypige: þonne ic beo unwemmed beforan Gode, gif ic me gehealde fram minre unrihtwisnesse.
Ure agen willa us is forboden, þonne halig gewrit þus clypaþ: Gecyr þu fram þinum lustum; eft on gebede we halsiað urne drihten, þæt his willa on us gewunige.

Eornostlice we synt gelærede be geweorhtan, þæt we be agenum willan ne wyrcen, þonne we þæt bewarniað, þæt halig gewrit, þe þus clypað: Sume wegas syndan, þe mannum syn rihte geþuhte, þara ænde þeah besencð on helle grunde.
We us eft andrædað þurh þæt halige gewrit, þe þus clypað: Hy synt gewemmede and andsæte gewordene on heora agenum lustum.

Wite we eac to soðe, þæt drihten a bið andweard on urum flæslicum lustum and him ures anginnes nan ðing digle ne bið; ðæt gesweotelað se witega, þus to Gode clypiende: Beforan þe is, drihten, eall min gewilnung.
Be þam halig gewrit monað, þus cweþende: Ne far ðu æfter þinum lustum.

Eornostlice, nu Godes gesyhða behealdað ægðer ge gode ge yfele, and drihten of heofonum symle behylt ofer manna bearn, þæt he geseo hwæþer heora ænig andgyttol sy and God secende, and nu fram þam englum us betæhtum ure weorc dæges and nihtes drihtne, urum scyppendum, beoð gebodude, us is miclom to warnienne, leofe gebroþra, swa hit on þam salmum awriten is, þylæs þe God on ænigne timan us geseo bugende to yfele and to nahte gehweorfan, and us þeah on þisne timan arige, forðan þe he milde is and geanbidað, þæt we to beteran gecyrren, þæt he us eft ne afyrre on þam toweardum, þus cweðende: þis ge dydon, and ic swigode.
BE ÐAM OÐRAN EADMODNESSE STÆPE.

Oðer eadmodnesse stæpe is, þæt hwa his agenne willan ne lufige, ne his agenum lustum ne fylige, ac mid dædum ures drihtnes stefne geefenlæce, þe þus be him sylfum cwyð: Ne com ic toþy, þæt ic minne willan worhte, ac þæs þe me hider asænde, þæt is mines heofonlican fæder.
And eft is gecweden: Lust hæfð wite and nead wuldorbeah gegearwað, þæt is þæt hwa hine sylfne to Gode nyde and his agene lustas aweorpe.
BE ÐAM ÐRIDDAN EADMODNESSE STÆPE.

Ðridde eaðmodnesse stæpe is, þæt gehwylc for Godes lufan hine sylfne mid ealre eaðmodnesse his ealdrum underþeode, urne drihten geefenlæcende, be him se apostol þus cwið: He wearð gehyrsum toþi, þæt he willes deað þrowade.
BE ÐAM FEORÐAN EADMODNESSE STÆPE.

Feorða stæpe eaðmodnesse is, gif he on þære sylfan hyrsumnesse þolemod bið on heardum and on wiþerweardum þingum and <on> gehwylcum teonrædennum geþyld lufige and ne awacige, na ne his staþel ne lætende fram Gode ne buge.

Be þissum halig gewrit þus myngað: Se ðe þurhwunað oþ ende, he bið gehealden; eft is gecweden on haligum gewrite: Si gestrangod þin heorte and forþyldiga þinne drihten, þæt is, þola eall, þæt God be þe geþafað.

And eft is onywed, þæt þa getreowfullan for Godes ege ealle lifes wiðerweardnesse forþyldigian scylun, be hiora þolemodnesse is þus awriten: For þe, drihten, we synd ealne dæg to deaþe gewæhte; we synd to deaþe getealde swa swa sceap to gesnide.

Hie þeah orsorge be þam tohopan þæs godcundan edleanes, þus æfterfylgendlice mid blisse clypiað: We oferswiðredon on þysum eallum þurh þone þe us lufode, þæt is drihten; eft be þære ylecan þolemodnesse on halegum gewritum is þus gecweden: Drihten, þu fandodest ure; þu ameredest us on fyres fandunge, swa swa seolfor on fyre amered bið; ðu us belæddest on grin, þu gesettest gedrefednessa on urum bæcum.
Eft þæt ilce halige gewrit forðon geswutelað, þæt we under ealdra gymene beon scylen, þus cweðende: þu settest men ofer ure heafda, þæt is ealdras, þe us gewyldon.

Ge eac þurh Godes gebod earfeþa and teonrædena mid geþylde forberað, þæs halgan godspelles cwide gefyllende, þe þus cleopað: þonne þu geslegen sie on an gewenge, wænd þæt oðer to; ðam þe þine tunecan þe benæme, læt þinne wæfels to; geneadod to anre mile gange, gang willes twa.

Ðæt is on andgite: Se went oþer hleor to sleandum, se þe god deþ þæm, þe him yfeles uþe, se þe bletsað þæne, þe hine wyrigde, he læt þa hacelan to þæm, þe hine tunecan benæmbe, se gæþ sylfwilles twa mila, to anre geneadod, þonne he bið oferswiðed fram þam yfelan, he gewænt þane yfelan to gode.
Se þe þyllic bið, butan tweon he deð, swa swa Paulus cwæþ, þæt is, geþyldelice lease gebroðru forbyrð and eahtnesse for rihtwisnesse þolað and þa bletsað, þe hine wyrigdon.
BE ÐAM FIFTAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.
Se fifta stæpe eaðmodnesse is, gif he þurh eaðmodre andetnesse his abbode ne diglað ealle þa geðohtas, þe his heortan cumende and þa yfelu, þe on diglan fram him þurhtogene synd.

Be þam us halig gewrit myngað, þus cweþende: Onwreoh drihtne þinne weg, þæt is þine dæde, and hyht on hine; and eft hit cwið: Andettað drihtne, forþan þe he is god, forþan þe his mildheortnes is on ecnesse.
And eft cwið se witega: Minne gylt ic gecydde þe and mine unrihtwisnesse ic ne bediglode; ic gecwæð, ic bodige ongean me mine unrihtwisnesse drihtne, and þu forgeafe þa arleasnesse minre heortan.
BE ÐAM SYXTAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.
Se syxta stæpe eadmodnesse is, gif munuc eaðhylde bið and geþæf, þeah hine man wacne and unweorðne talige and an uteweardum forlæte and to uteweardum medemige.

On eallum betæhtum notum hine sylfne mid his mode wacne wyrhtan talige and unweorðne and þus mittan witegan clypige: To nahte ic wæs gehworfen, and ic hit nyste; ic eom geworden swilce nyten mid þe, and ic þeah simle mid þe.
BE ÐAM SEOFOÐAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.

Se seofeða stæpe eaðmodnesse is, gif munuc hine sylfne yttran and unweorðran talað þonne ænigne oþerne; he hine sylfne geeaðmede and þus mid þam witegan cwede: Ic soðlice eom wyrm and no man, manna hosp and folces æwyrp.
Anhafen ic wæs, genyþerod and gescend; and eft: God me is, þæt þu me genyþeradest, þæt ic leornige þine bebode.
BE ÐAM EHTEÐAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.
Se eahteoða stæpe eaðmodnesse is, gif se munuc nan þing ne deþ, butan þæt se gemæna mynstres regol tæcð, oþþe þæt þa bysena heahþungenra lærað.
BE ÐAM NIGEÐAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.

Se nygeða stæpe eaðmodnesse is, gif munuc his tungan fram spræce forhæfð and swigean healdende ne sprece, oð þæt he geahsod sy, be þam halig gewrit þus gesweotolað: On mænigfealdre spræce ne bið syn forbogen, and se ofersprecola wer ne þyhð ofer eorðan.
BE ÐAM TEOÐAN EAÐMODNESSE STÆPE.
Se teoða eaðmodnesse stæpe is, gif se munuc ne bið galsmære and eaðe and hræd on hlehtre, forþy hit is awriten: Se stunta on lehtre his stefne geuferað.
BE ÐAM ENDLYFTAN <EADMODNESSE> <STÆPE>.
